Every year a strategic business planning exercise is undertaken. This exercise involves all our teams from the Leadership levels across to the frontline. For the forthcoming year’s strategy, operating business plans and big initiatives are kicked off in September/October timeframe. The strategy and operating plan are then finalised in November in a senior management meeting.

An important perspective to this exercise is the complete awareness and accountability that is accepted by the entire organisation. This plan is socialised with the next level broader management team and then cascaded down for further action. Business/ Function/ Practice level plans, budgets, and support sought from each other are fleshed out and agreed upon.

We have designed a calendar-driven process for reviewing progress on our Annual Strategic/Business Plans. To the extent possible, we try and objectify all goals and review them accordingly. A close watch is kept on all numbers/metrics to ensure success in all areas of functioning.

The acronym is V2MOM, and it stands for Vision, Values, Methods, Obstacles, and Measurements. Marc Benioff, Co-founder and CEO of Salesforce, developed the template for setting annual goals across an organisation. Our CEO Raj creates a new V1MOM and shares it with the entire company. In addition, every employee is encouraged to create and publish their own annual V2mOM plan.

V2MOM works well when integrated with other frameworks and methods. The flow of adaptation usually begins with the creation of the strategy (or strategic intent) Then we can cascade the strategy to departments, teams, and products. Then we utilise OKRs (Objectives and Key Results) to provide role clarity and performance metrics.

Apart from designing an effective strategy and then using our V2MOM systems to cascade goals across the organisation, we also believe in growing & developing an effective leadership cadre. We believe that having a great process is simply not enough! We need competent leaders across levels and functions to be able to succeed.

We have created the Company1_IT Leadership Behavior framework to identify leadership competencies. This drives a common framework for key ‘Success Behavior expectations’ for our colleagues in leadership roles. We have created a set of key expectations for each member of our leadership team.

This framework, which is deeply aligned with our culture, consists of six leadership capabilities which are uniform across levels. Each leadership capability is further defined by eight identifiable behaviours which can be observed and assessed. While the capabilities are standard across levels, the behavioural indicators become progressively more complex with varied levels and functions of leadership.

A major Life Science Customer wanted Company1_IT to take over development (which was running behind schedule and having quality issues) from another vendor and deliver the product to their end customer within the original agreed timeline. Project involved Temperature Excursion Management with complex algorithms and many external integration points.

Company1_IT ramped up a team of 50 with relevant skillset on a war-foot. imparted product trainings, conducted exhaustive planning sessions, identified risks & mitigation steps to meet the deadline. Company1-IT is based in Sydney, Australia.

Collaborated and hosted multiple co-locations with employees, customer and external parties. Company1_IT invested in CoE teams to address NFRs and Delivery Excellence team to address Life Science Regulatory documentation standards. Excellent tracking and monitoring, critical reviews & feedback, team commitment & collaboration resulted in project going Live as per the commitment.

Achieving this important goal on time with our promise to GSK is a true team effort and a great example of what we can achieve when collaborating across teams and functions. We faced many obstacles during the project, but with your dedication and willpower even the toughest obstacles were resolved.

This has taken a small army to get to this point, full of challenges with many teams to allow us to successfully hit this milestone for GSK. TEM will be a key new lever in helping move our larger on prem customers to SaaS, and also attract new Supplies customers as we incorporate full cumulative excursion tracking into our clinical supplies inventory management platform.

Company1_IT has embraced ONE approach, which stands for Open to all cultures. We strive to create an environment where employees feel that their background, and lifestyle do not affect perceptions of them as a professional. We ensure that associates or potential hires, third-party support staff, and suppliers are not unlawfully discriminated against.

Our Founder and CEO, Raj Mamodia recently signed a statement to uphold the United Nation’s Women Empowerment Principles. This is a commitment to put into action gender equality and women's empowerment. We are committed to gender equality, women's rights and empowerment.

Company1_IT's WoW (With Our Women) Program aims to have women represent 33% of the company by 2022. Currently, we are at 28% (up 2% from the last year). We can and will do better. We will have one woman leader join our board of directors by 2022, says CEO.

Diversity initiatives: While we recognize and promote diversity in all forms, we have prioritized our focus on gender diversity initiatives. Our workplace policies play a critical role in reinforcing our commitment underpinning our ways to achieve it. Company1_IT WoW (With Our Women) Program in March 2020, as part of which we have taken several action steps.

As a first step, we have come up with a D&I Policy and have created an email id which acts as eyes and ears for women employees. Our Overall Gender diversity ratio is 28%, and 16% women in leadership. In 2020 two practices out of five practices achieved 30% diversity.

We conducted a women employee, open-ended survey to understand how women in Company1_IT feel. What are the challenges faced by women? We found out some areas for improvement. And accordingly, we introduced various initiatives to make Company1-IT a safe and inclusive place to work.

100 Women Any employees covered, who learnt on Leading Self, Career & others through a blended fun-based learning program. Best-in-class industry coaches, external networking, e-contents, webinars, newsletters & peer to peer learning. Investing in the development of Women Leaders across levels and roles as an agenda is imperative for Company1_IT.

WOW Circle – a peer group initiative on Work-Life Balance, Fitness & Grooming, and Continuous Learning, provides a safe place for Company1_IT women to connect, rejoice, network, and explore solutions together. We have actively engaged nearly 350 Women (more than 50% of our Women) through our WOW Circle initiatives. Women engagement programs and fun activities are conducted on Fridays.

We proudly present to you the Bringing Smiles programme. This is ‘the jewel’ in our crown this year. The primary focus is to prepare young people in the 10 to 16-year age bracket globally for careers and life in a digital-centric, entrepreneurial, and disruptive world.

This employee volunteering program is integrated with the CSR strategy, and the focus is to improve quality education in govt. Schools with STEM Education. Overall, 1400 Volunteers clocked 47,000 volunteering hours to date and Total Smiles Delivered in 2022: 500 volunteers clocked 11,570 volunteering hours.

We conduct volunteering with Govt schools where we support them through our CSR Projects. Our Programs are designed to leverage the employees’ skills and the partner’s requirements. Since Company1_IT is an IT Services Company, this also helps employees to appreciate and take pride in the company as a purpose-led organisation.

We reach out to the beneficiaries, understand their gap in improving their digital literacy. We also give exposure to advanced technology like Metaverse, AI & ML, Scratch programming, pencil coding etc. This helps bridge the divide and ignites young minds in the most meaningful way.

We believe that for any project to sustain and grow, the employees/ volunteers need to be highly motivated. At Company1_IT, these are a few ways in which we do this. We hope that this article will help you in the same way as it helped us.

Every month, employees who have contributed substantially to the program will be featured on our company's social media handle. We also have the Precious You program; these are employees who clock a minimum of 10 hours of volunteering. We chose the top 10 volunteers who clocked the most hours for an all-expense hike trip. We plan to resume that this year for the 2022 Awards.

Scholarships provided financial, and mentorship support to meritorious students from government schools to pursue coaching for IIT JEE/CET/NEET. 21 Company1_IT Leaders are involved in 1:1 mentoring the students to prepare for the exams.

In this program, employees record academic/non-academic books with their voices in a sound-proof studio, a digital library to make education accessible for people with visual disabilities, dyslexia, and verbal processing difficulties.  The program is available to students in grades 7-12.

The books are being scanned, typed, recorded, and edited by Company1_IT Volunteers and the team at Samarthanam(our NGO partner) to ensure optimum quality of work to provide easy access to content in a digital audio mode to persons with disabilities.

The students competed weekly in ‘Miss Maker & Master Maker’ science and mathematics Model Competitions, Tech Quizzes, and Engineering Tinkering. Weekly activity-based learning with volunteers is happening through quizzes, videos, and storytelling to engage the students. Weekly teaching sessions (1-6 months)

Science models like Laser Security alarms, Vacuum cleaners, Hydraulic bridges and many more are made by Children with the Company1_IT Science DIY kits and the guidance of the teachers and the trainers and Volunteers. Competition happens at the cluster, zonal and mega Finale rounds.

TGIF is a new way of giving back to society where Fridays are called TGIF (Thank God it’s Friday!). Every Friday between 2-3.30 pm, Company1_IT employees, or ‘Any employees’ as we call ourselves, get together and immerse in various volunteering programs. As part of the initiative, employees visit government schools to teach English and Mathematics to students.

In this program, we invite children from various government schools to interact with employees and attend half-day workshops every month. The workshops expose the children to the latest technologies, such as Wearables, VR, AR, and AI. The children also get an opportunity to work on exciting science experiments that supplement their daily education.

1:1 mentoring through telephone. Our employees call the students daily for 30 days and mentor them, student, for half an hour on Basic English speaking, inspiring stories etc. We also teach them how to use the internet and social networking sites like Facebook and Twitter.

Employees good at interpersonal skills train rural undergrad students from Karnataka on various life skills. Close to 100 students have benefitted through this. Communication skills, career guidance, time management, relationship building, out-of-the-box thinking, etc. are taught.

Employees donate their leaves, and the amount equivalent will be donated to the selected organisations. During COVID, employees donated our vacation for food supplies to the needy and educational materials to children in India and US. 2000 families were supported by our volunteers through fundraising and donating their vacation.

Company1_IT Volunteer e-Teachers engage and teach children in five rural schools on a weekly basis, right from their cubicles or living rooms. Currently, we have set up rural teaching classrooms in Karnataka, Bihar & Jharkhand, and our employees also teach in Andhra Pradesh & West Bengal schools.

Our volunteers have trained teachers and students with Microsoft Office -Digital literacy tools. These teachers facilitated daily online classes for the students. One of the teachers was selected to take online classes on National TV. This has empowered schoolteachers to deliver the promise of a digital tomorrow.

Employees fulfill the wishes of deprived children and become a part of the Joy of Giving. Students are encouraged to share their wishes, and our employees fulfil the same. We hope to see more of this in the coming months and years. For more information, visit www.joyofgiving.org.
